#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Hajar Mountains
#Text=The Hajar Mountains are a range in Northern Oman stretching along the northern coast of Oman , from southwest of Muscat to the United Arab Emirates .
#Text=Understand
#Text=This dramatic mountain range has a wealth of attractions for the adventurous traveler , including trekking , rock climbing , canyoning , and off-road exploration .
#Text=In addition to outdoor activities , there are numerous sights of historic , cultural , and geological interest .
#Text=Temperatures in the higher elevations tend to be on average 10-15°C cooler than Muscat , and snow , although very rare , is not unknown .
#Text=In summer the mountains offer a retreat for those looking to escape the heat baking the rest of Oman and the Arabian peninsula .
#Text=Get in
#Text=From Muscat , Highways 15 and 21 skirt the southern reaches of the range , and Highways 13 and 11 provide access from the north .
#Text=Travelers from the UAE will arrive via Highway 21 .
#Text=Get around

#Text=It is possible to get a glimpse of some of the mountains ' spectacular scenery with just a 2WD , but to really explore a 4WD is essential , as many highlights are otherwise simply inaccessible .
#Text=See
#Text=Archaeological Sites of Bat , Al-Khutm and Al-Ayn ( from Hwy 21 , turn north at the petrol station between Nizwa and Ibri , following signs for Amla , Al Ayn , Damm/Dham , and Sint ) .
#Text=Three sites of prehistoric settlements and beehive tombs dating from the 3rd millennium BCE , collectively inscribed on the UNESCO World Heritage list .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Bat .
#Text=This site was excavated in 1976 and includes communal graves , ruins of tower forts , and beehive tombs .
#Text=Al-Khutm ( 2 km west of Bat ) .
#Text=This site contains the ruins of a stone tower 20 m in diameter .
#Text=Al Ayn ( Al Ain ) .
#Text=These unexcavated beehive tombs here are in much better condition than those at Bat , with the added dramatic backdrop of Jebel Misht and its 1000m-high cliffs .
#Text=To access them , take the graded road to the left ( just past the junction ) , and turn right and drive 100 m down the wadi .
#Text=From here a footpath leads to the tombs .
#Text=Wadi Tanuf ( Wadi Tanoof ) ( access from Hwy 21 ) .
#Text=At the mouth of the wadi are the photogenic ruins of Old Tanuf , which was bombed extensively by the British Royal Air Force during the Jebel Rebellion of 1954-1955 .
#Text=A 4WD track proceeds up the wadi past a recharge dam to the trailheads for W19 and W19a ( not waymarked ) , two excellent hikes through and above neighboring Wadi Qashah .

#Text=Al Hoota Cave ( Al Hutah , Al Hotta , Al Fallah , Al Falahi ) , Al Hoota Cave Rd ( turn off of Hwy 21 enroute to Al Hamra ) , ☏ +96824498258 ( reservations required ) , ✉ reserve@alhootacave.com .
#Text=A 2.7-km-long living cave network with a large chamber of stalactites and stalagmites , as well as a 800-m-long lake , home to a species of blind fish .
#Text=There is also a geological museum onsite , as well as a cafe and gift shop . RO 6.5/3 ( non-Omani adults/children 6-12 ) , RO 3/1 ( Omani adults/children 6-12 ) , free ( children under 6 ) .
#Text=Misfat al Abriyyin ( Misfah ) ( 5km north of Al Hamra ) .
#Text=One of the few mountain villages accessible by 2WD on a paved road .
#Text=The ancient village is in a beautiful setting , with terraced gardens and a falaj irrigation system .
#Text=The ruined fort of Al Rogan overlooks the village , which is the starting point for the challenging W9 trekking path , connecting with trails W8 and W10h .
#Text=Donkeys and guides are available for hire here as well .
#Text=Misfah Old House , ☏ +96899338491 , ✉ bandb.misfah@gmail.com .
#Text=One of only a couple of accommodation options available in the village , in a traditional Omani house with Omani cuisine cooked by local families .
#Text=Arrangements for guides can be made here .
#Text=No internet .
#Text=RO 25 / singles , RO 50 /doubles , including half-board ; cash only .
#Text=Al Hamra .
#Text=Set right at the base of the mountains , this town is notable for a number of Yemeni-style mud-brick buildings , some of which are among the oldest houses in Oman .

#Text=They are in an older section of the town overlooking the newer town ; in recent years many of the older houses have been abandoned as the inhabitants have chosen to move into more modern buildings .
#Text=Rustaq Fort .
#Text=This restored fortress in the northern foothills has four watch towers and dates to the 13th century .
#Text=The complex includes a mosque , a former prison and a falaj system .
#Text=It has been nominated for listing as a UNESCO World Heritage site .
#Text=Nakhal Fort , ☏ +96826781384 .
#Text=A restored fortress with a history dating to the pre-Islamic era , scenically situated on a rocky outcropping at the base of the northern Hajar Mountains .
#Text=The fort houses a museum of historic guns . 500 Bzs ( adults ) .
#Text=Jebel Akhdar
#Text=Jebel Akhdar ( ' Green Mountain ' ) is topped by the vast Sayq Plateau ( Saiq Plateau ) , home to traditional mountain villages , fruit orchards , and terraced gardens .
#Text=Oman 's most highly-prized rosewater is produced here , and springtime is particularly beautiful when the fruit trees and rose gardens are all in bloom .
#Text=This is a cool destination even during the height of summer , and in winter temperatures drop below freezing .
#Text=It is possible to visit as a very ambitious day trip , but to really appreciate it is best to allow a couple of days .
#Text=The road is newly paved and in excellent condition but a 4WD is mandatory ; travelers without a suitable car will be turned back at the police checkpoint .
#Text=From Highway 15 , take the turnoff for Birkat al Mawz .
#Text=Turn left at the T-junction ( following signs for ' Nizwa ' ) , and then follow the signs for '
#Text=Al Jabal al Akhdar ' .
#Text=On the right you 'll pass , a thousand-year-old fortress , now fully restored and open to the public .
#Text=A 4WD is required to pass the , where you must show your driver 's license and car registration .
#Text=From here you 'll need to use low gear .
#Text=500 m after passing ( tel . +968 25 429009 ) , turn left for Sayh Qutnah .
#Text=After 3 km the road forks ; take the road to the left and proceed 700 m to ( tel . +968 25 429288 ) .
#Text=A little way further is the scenic , so named after the Princess of Wales visited in 1990 via helicopter .
#Text=Some good campsites are nearby , as is the ( tel . +968 2521 8000 , doubles RO 132+ ) .
#Text=The trailhead for ( Village Walk ) begins in the village below the Sahab Hotel .
#Text=This 2-hour hike passes through the cliff-hugging terraced gardens of Al Ayn , Ash Shirayjah , and Sayq and offers outstanding views of the deep wadis below .
#Text=If you like you can continue for another 1.5-2 hours along W18a to .
#Text=A short path near the public toilets leads to an abandoned village of mudbrick houses overlooking photogenic plantations .
